page.title: 02THETFORD WARREN LODGE
page.content: Unfortunately this building was badly damaged by fire in 1935 but has been restored. It is thought to have been built in the 14C or 15C as the dwelling and headquarters of the keeper of the Warren, which was estab- lished in Norman times.Similar archi- tecture to this square building can be found at Mildenhall Warren, Suffolk. It is maintained as shown in the photo graphs by the English Heritage in a clearing in the Thetford Forest. The car park for visiting this site is situated on a stretch of land conser- ved as Breckland was until afforest- ation.The rabbit population kept the land cropped and bare to the sandy soil also as shown.
